intro: Borreria tenuiflora, commonly known as the narrow-flowered borreria, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Borreria tenuiflora is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance.
